name: Bandit, Bandit Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did the license plate on Bandit's car read?
questions.explanation:
Bandit1.

	The car, a Dodge Stealth, was solid black and sleek looking. The plate was identified during the movie opening when the county sheriff read it over the radio and requested backup.

questions.text: Where was the Bandit when he was supposed to be delivering a car to a press conference with the governor?
questions.correct: He was in the county jail
options: In bed with a random woman
Watching football in a hotel room
questions.explanation:
He was in the county jail.

	He was in the Buford County jail. Buford County was a call back to Sheriff Buford T. Justice from the theatrical version of the movie franchise.  Rather than waiting to be released, he was broken out of jail soon after arriving.

questions.text: Bandit's semi truck was stolen at the beginning of the movie.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The truck was taken by a Bandit lookalike who then used the truck to make a pickup that Bandit was supposed to make. The lookalike had impersonated the Bandit earlier in the day in order to get him arrested as well.

questions.text: What restaurant was the fake Bandit at when the waitress called to tell the real Bandit about him?
questions.explanation:
JoJo's.

	The waitress called Bandit to tell him that an impersonator was at the restaurant. She agreed to keep him there, but by the time she got off the phone he was leaving the parking lot already. Instead she stopped the imposter in the parking lot and got in the truck.

questions.text: What is painted on the side of the trailer that Bandit's tractor pulls?
questions.correct: A mural with his own car jumping a bridge.
options: A large photo of his own face.
A huge science fiction mural with ships from several TV shows.
It's a plain white trailer, nothing on the side.
questions.explanation:
A mural with his own car jumping a bridge.

	The custom paint job is on both sides of the trailer. The word "Bandit" is also written on the mural.  The mural pays homage to a similar mural on the trailer in the big screen "Smokey & The Bandit" films, but it is different.

questions.text: Other than in his car and big rig, what other form of transportation did Bandit travel by?
questions.explanation:
Airplane.

	He literally caught the plane as it was taking off and climbed inside after it left the ground. It was a two-seater biplane painted blue and yellow. According to the pilot she was on her way to the airshow. Bandit also flew in a helicopter during the movie.

questions.text: Who was driving Bandit's car when it went into the lake?
questions.explanation:
Lynn.

	Lynn was apprehended by the county sheriff. He was called Lynn, but once his real name was revealed, Howard Lenier Denton III, he was released. He was the son of the governor.

questions.text: What was the name of the shipping company that the prototype car was loaded on after it was moved from off of Bandit's truck?
questions.explanation:
Pony Brothers Trucking.

	The truck was driven by Chuck Pony. It was a light blue cab with "Pony Brothers Trucking" written on the trailer. He was set to deliver the car to Charleston.

questions.text: Who was the radio DJ who kept talking about Bandit and the events of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Big Bob Bentley.

	He was played by Richard Belzer. Big Bob Bentley was the first journalist to crack the story about the prototype car being missing and kept his listeners apprised of the situation the whole day.  He even left open lines for people with cell phones to call in updates to the show. Remember this was 1994, cellphones weren't all that common.

questions.text: At the end of the movie, Bandit had failed to recover the car and was arrested for stealing it.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He managed to catch up to Chuck Pony and get the car out of the back of his truck. Then he took the car and ended up at the Governor's mansion with the car. Of  course he couldn't just show up driving the car, he hooked it to a chain and had it flown in to the press conference by helicopter.
